page.title: 08 THE MOORS MURDERS
page.content: The dark shadow that hovered over Hattersley for the last twenty years and still lingers is the Moors Murder case. Ian Brady and Myra Hindley lived at 16,Wardle Brook Avenue. In November 1963 John Kilbride was missing,December 1964 Leslie Ann Downey was missing and in October 1965 Edward Evans was murdered. Ian Brady and Myra Hindley were caught with Edward Evans dead body in the house. The trial began in April 1966. Both were found guilty and jailed for life. They are still serving sentence. Local people are still very sensitive about the subject and the majority unforgiving. Manchester Corporation often have letters from people who want to live in the Moors Murderers house. Others prefer any house but that one.
